comment.body: I'll be following IPZN closely, and contribute to it when I can.
IIRC someone already did do IPFS + Tor for OpenBazaar.
Easy enabling/disabling of plugins from the UI is a good thing. It only includes official plugins by default.

No access to the full internet? Good luck posting to that blockchain!

Using ZN? Post whenever, wherever you like. Synchronize however you like: hotspot, LAN, bluetooth, USB stick etc.

Blockchain is amazing, don't get me wrong, but it's not a good backend to a decentralized system. It's really good at being uncensorable though.
I agree with @Pexo, t's too easy to attack small sites in such a system. It does sound a bit like i2p where you have multiple "dns" where the users selects which one they wish to use.

@blurHY: As long as the cryptocurrencies are not an integral part (i.e. as long as the network can be split and merged in any way without ceasing to work) I’m not entirely against integration of cryptocurrency-based functionality. Paid ZeroNet storage, and proxies are things I’d like to see happen at some point.
I like a lot of the ideas you’re proposing, but why use Telegram? There’s plenty enough discussion platforms on ZN.

I think “A better ZeroNet, made with IPFS” would feel less awkward. But I’m more of a proponent for the tagline: “ZeroNet, or IPFS... [Why not both?”](https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/why-not-both-why-dont-we-have-both) (clearnet)
hey, you're still around :-) sweet to hear about your plans!
I'm rather saddened by your accusations. What makes you think zeronet devs don't comprehend IPFS?
Communism has killed me 30 times, I only survived because they didn't have enough breadlines.
